result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank V Blonda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING FEBRUARY 20, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 23.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including supervision fees and DNA, DV and victim witness surcharges from bail on deposit.  Balance due during probation period. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds. Balance paid during Extended supervision and collected by DOC.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised due to DV conviction under Federal Law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote in until civil rights are restored.

No violent contact with victim.
No driving without a valid driver's license.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and extensive breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: Serve 50 days as to each count.  STAYED pending review hearing.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive.  Straight time.  To be served with count one at Wisconsin State Prison.

miscConds.notes: Conditions as listed in count one.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. PSI reviewed. Additional Sentencing documentation reviewed. Corrections made on the record. Additional Statements by the victim.Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 27 MONTHS, consecutive, credit for 7 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS , the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a the House of Correction for 2 MONTHS, consecutive, straight time, to be served with Count 1 at the Wisconsin State Prison. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 50 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens & extensive breathalyzers.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim. 
-No driving without a valid driver's license.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges from bail on deposit, balance due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. If revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision and collected by DOC.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Defendant Frank V Blonda in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Charles Blumenfield who represents the victim, appeared on the record. Bail motion by defense argued, by all parties. 
Court modified bail to Cash Bail, with turnover to Justice Point for GPS Supervision with a 24 HOUR curfew, release ONLY for legal & work (on site only). Court ordered drug testing, breathlyzers, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of dangerous weapons, no use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription, comply with no contact order. Case remains set for Sentencing on 9/4/2014 at 1:30 pm in branch 23.
Received & Filed, 2 Letter's To the Court.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. At the hour of 4:15 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict which was then read.  
AS TO COUNT 1: GUILTY
AS TO COUNT 2: GUILTY
Court polled and discharged the jury. Jury released and out of the box at 4:19 pm. Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. State's request for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report, GRANTED without recommendation. Order, Signed & Filed. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court further advised defendant his prohibited under federal law from possession of a firearm. Case adjourned for Bail Hearing and Sentencing to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion regarding Jury Instructions.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 2:15 pm. Alternate juror selected by lot and released. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense. Court held a side bar conversation with state and defense counsel. Rebuttal Closing arguments by the state. Court held side bar conversations with the state and defense counsel. Continued Rebuttal closing arguments from the state.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:21 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Browne & Zielinski who were duly sworn for that purpose. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Parties stipulated and signed exhibit list, filed. Case in recess pending verdict.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Discussion regarding alleged violations, and pretrial issues. Jury in the box at 9:26 am.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Vimcemza L. Exhibit's 4, 5, 6 & 7 received and published to the Jury. Sworn for the state: Oak Creek Police Officer Scott Sadowski. State's exhibit's 1, 2 & 3 received & published to the jury. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 10:22 pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Court in recess. Defendant sworn by the court. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his right to remain silent. Court found the willingly and knowingly WAIVED his right to remain silent, defendant will testify. Discussion regarding previous rulings by the court. Jury in the box at 11:15 am. Sworn for the defense: Frank Blonda, defendant. Court held side bar in chambers with state and defense counsel. Testimony continued. Court held side bar with state and defense counsel. Testimony continued. Court instructed and released the Jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 11:55 am. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Case in recess to 1:30 pm.
Case transferred to branch 23 from branch 40, on a spin.

Defendant Frank V Blonda in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Branch 23, Judge Grady agreed to hear Jury Trial for Branch 40, Judge Dallet on a spin. Discussion regarding pretrial motions, rulings placed on the record. Discussion regarding scheduling and instructions. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:22 pm. Jury panel released for a break. Jury panel out of the box at 3:32 pm. Court held in chambers, both parties, and staff present. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Jury panel member #18 in chambers at 3:45 p.m. Additional Voir dire of #18. Jury panel member #18 out of chambers at 3:47 pm. Continued discussion regarding strikes for cause. Jury panel in court at 3:55 pm. At the hour of 4:06 pm. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Jury list received and filed. Panel members not selected were dismissed to Jury Management. Jury out of the box at 4:07 pm.  Jury in the box at 4:23 pm. Jury sworn. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Court held side bar with state and defense counsel. Opening Statments continued. Court instructed and released jury for the day at 4:42pm. Jury ordered to return on 7/17/2014 at 8:30 am in branch 23. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Jury trial scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
